Package edu.ncsu.csc216.product_backlog.model.backlog

Class BacklogManager

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.product_backlog.model.backlog.BacklogManager
public class BacklogManager extends Object
Manages all of the products and interacts with the GUI This class implements the Singleton design pattern. This means that only one instance of the BacklogManager can ever be created. This is the reason why the constructor is private and why the getInstance method calls the constructor
Author:
Ethan Browne

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static BacklogManager getInstance()
      Checks to see if the singleton is null and if it is creates a instance of BacklogManager with constructor
      Returns:
      instance of Backlog Manager

    • addProduct

      public void addProduct(String productName)
      Creates a new Product with the given name and adds it to the end of the products list
      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if productName is invalid

    • editProduct

      public void editProduct(String updateName)
      Updates the currentProductâ€™s name to the given value
      Parameters:
      updateName - the new name of the products
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no product is selected
      IllegalArgumentException - if productName is invalid

    • deleteProduct

      public void deleteProduct()
      Deletes the currentProduct
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if no product is selected

    • loadProduct

      public void loadProduct(String productName)
      Find the Product with the given name in the list, make it the active or currentProduct
      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if product can not be found

    • getProductName

      public String getProductName()
      Returns the name of the current product. if no product is selected then it returns null
      Returns:
      the name of the current product

    • getProductList

      public String[] getProductList()
      Returns a String array of product names in the order they are listed in the products list. This is used by the GUI to populate the product drop down.
      Returns:
      array of product names

    • clearProducts

      public void clearProducts()
      Resets products to an empty list. The currentProduct is set to null.

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile(String fileName)
      Reads from a file and adds all of the new Products in the file to the end of product list. The first product in the list is made the currentProduct
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile(String fileName)
      Writes the products in the list to the file named fileName
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if unable to save file because current product is null or has no tasks

    • getTasksAsArray

      public String[][] getTasksAsArray()
      Returns a 2d string array that represents the task in the current product
      Returns:
      a 2d string array with task id, state name, type as long string, and title

      Returns:

      Adds a task to the product given the following parameters
      Parameters:
